column4: left
column6: left

column4: Description
column6: Test Steps

column4: Validate OpenShift API server is accessible and responsive
column6: 1. Execute oc login command; 2. Run oc get nodes; 3. Verify API response time < 2 seconds
column7: API accessible; all nodes listed; response within SLA

column4: Verify all control plane components are operational
column6: 1. Check etcd cluster health; 2. Verify API server pods; 3. Check controller-manager; 4. Verify scheduler pods
column7: All control plane components in Running state

column4: Validate worker nodes are properly registered and ready
column6: 1. Run oc get nodes; 2. Verify Ready status; 3. Check node conditions; 4. Validate node labels
column7: All 3 worker nodes in Ready status

column4: Verify pods can be scheduled on worker nodes
column6: 1. Deploy test pod; 2. Verify pod scheduled; 3. Check pod running; 4. Validate node placement
column7: Pod scheduled and running within 60 seconds

column4: Validate user authentication against corporate LDAP
column6: 1. Login via OpenShift console; 2. Enter AD credentials; 3. Verify user authenticated; 4. Check group membership
column7: User authenticated; groups mapped to RBAC roles

column4: Verify role-based access control enforcement
column6: 1. Login as admin user; 2. Verify admin access; 3. Login as developer; 4. Verify restricted access

column4: Validate Tekton pipeline execution end-to-end
column5: Pipelines operator installed; test repo ready
column6: 1. Create PipelineRun; 2. Monitor task execution; 3. Verify build stage; 4. Check deploy stage

column4: Validate ArgoCD application synchronization
column6: 1. Create ArgoCD application; 2. Trigger sync; 3. Verify resources created; 4. Check sync status

column4: Validate container image push and pull operations
column6: 1. Build container image; 2. Push to Quay; 3. Pull from Quay; 4. Verify image integrity

column4: Verify metrics collection from cluster and applications
column6: 1. Access Prometheus UI; 2. Query cluster metrics; 3. Verify application metrics; 4. Check metric retention
column7: Metrics collected; queries return expected data

column4: Validate Grafana dashboards display metrics correctly
column6: 1. Access Grafana; 2. Load cluster dashboard; 3. Verify data displayed; 4. Check all panels

column4: Verify log collection and aggregation in Kibana
column6: 1. Generate application logs; 2. Access Kibana; 3. Search for logs; 4. Verify log timestamps

column4: Complete application deployment workflow
column6: 1. Push code to Git; 2. Pipeline triggered; 3. Image built; 4. ArgoCD syncs; 5. App running
column7: Application deployed via GitOps within 20 minutes

column4: Developer self-service namespace provisioning
column6: 1. Login as developer; 2. Create namespace; 3. Deploy application; 4. Verify access controls

column4: left
column6: left

column4: Description
column6: Test Steps

column4: Validate 99.5% uptime requirement
column6: 1. Monitor cluster for 30 days; 2. Track any downtime; 3. Calculate availability percentage

column4: Verify API response time under normal load
column6: 1. Execute API calls; 2. Measure response times; 3. Calculate p95 latency; 4. Compare to baseline

column4: Validate container startup time requirements
column6: 1. Deploy new pod; 2. Measure time to running; 3. Repeat 10 times; 4. Calculate average

column4: Verify CI/CD pipeline execution time
column6: 1. Execute standard pipeline; 2. Measure total duration; 3. Repeat 5 times; 4. Calculate average

column4: Validate platform handles concurrent deployments
column6: 1. Trigger 10 simultaneous deployments; 2. Monitor resource usage; 3. Verify all complete; 4. Check for failures
column7: All deployments complete without resource contention

column4: Verify workload recovery after node failure
column6: 1. Simulate worker node failure; 2. Monitor pod rescheduling; 3. Measure recovery time; 4. Verify application availability
column7: Pods rescheduled within 5 minutes; zero data loss

column4: Validate network policies restrict traffic correctly
column6: 1. Test allowed traffic flows; 2. Test denied traffic flows; 3. Verify policy logging; 4. Check egress controls

column4: Verify pod security policies prevent privileged containers
column6: 1. Deploy privileged pod; 2. Verify admission denied; 3. Deploy compliant pod; 4. Verify allowed
column7: Privileged pods rejected; compliant pods allowed

column4: Validate etcd encryption for Kubernetes secrets
column6: 1. Create secret; 2. Verify encrypted in etcd; 3. Retrieve via API; 4. Confirm decrypted correctly
column7: Secrets encrypted at rest; accessible via API

column4: Verify all endpoints use valid TLS certificates
column6: 1. Check API server cert; 2. Check router certs; 3. Verify cert chain; 4. Check expiration dates

column4: Validate container images pass security scanning
column6: 1. Push test image; 2. Run vulnerability scan; 3. Review findings; 4. Verify no critical CVEs

column4: Validate backup and restore procedures work correctly
column6: 1. Create ETCD backup; 2. Simulate data loss; 3. Execute restore; 4. Verify cluster state
column7: Cluster restored to backup state within 30 minutes

column4: Verify persistent volumes survive pod restarts
column6: 1. Create PVC and write data; 2. Delete pod; 3. Recreate pod; 4. Verify data persisted

column4: Validate HPA scales pods based on load
column6: 1. Apply load to application; 2. Monitor pod count; 3. Verify scale-up; 4. Remove load; 5. Verify scale-down
column7: Pods scale up/down based on CPU thresholds

column4: left
column6: left

column4: Description
column6: Test Steps

column4: Validate developers can deploy applications independently
column6: 1. Login as developer; 2. Create namespace; 3. Deploy from template; 4. View application

column4: Validate complete GitOps workflow from code to deployment
column6: 1. Commit code change; 2. Pipeline auto-triggers; 3. Image built and scanned; 4. ArgoCD deploys
column7: Code changes deployed automatically via pipeline

column4: Validate operations team can monitor applications
column6: 1. Access Grafana; 2. View application metrics; 3. Check alerting rules; 4. Verify notification
column7: Operations can monitor all deployed applications

column4: Validate support team can troubleshoot via logs
column6: 1. Access Kibana; 2. Search application logs; 3. Filter by time range; 4. Export relevant logs
column7: Support can locate and analyze application logs

column4: Validate administrators can manage cluster via console
column6: 1. Login to console; 2. Navigate workloads; 3. View node status; 4. Access project quotas

column4: Validate GitOps management via ArgoCD UI
column6: 1. Login to ArgoCD; 2. View sync status; 3. Trigger manual sync; 4. Review health status
column7: ArgoCD UI shows accurate application state

column4: Validate registry management via Quay UI
column6: 1. Login to Quay; 2. Browse repositories; 3. View vulnerability scans; 4. Manage image tags
column7: Quay UI provides image management capabilities

column4: Validate operations can respond to platform alerts
column6: 1. Trigger test alert; 2. Verify PagerDuty notification; 3. Follow runbook; 4. Resolve alert
column7: Operations receives alerts and can respond per runbook

column4: Validate operations can monitor and plan capacity
column6: 1. Review resource utilization; 2. Check quota usage; 3. Generate capacity report; 4. Identify growth needs
column7: Operations can track and forecast capacity requirements

column4: Validate operations can perform platform updates
column5: Update documentation available; test cluster ready
column6: 1. Review release notes; 2. Execute update in test; 3. Verify cluster health; 4. Document results
column7: Operations can safely update platform following procedures
